How To Use Avarampoo For Diabetes In Tamil

Avarampoo is a common ayurvedic herb that is used in the treatment of diabetes in Tamil Nadu. This herb, which is also known as ‘senna’ or ‘botanically, Cassia auriculata,’ is found in abundance in forests and also in many parts of South India.

The avarampoo herb is known to be rich in medicinal properties and is appreciated in Ayurveda, for its anti-diabetic action. It possess anti-diabetic properties and also helps in fighting inflammation and improves the overall health of an individual suffering from diabetes mellitus.

Avarampoo can be used in the treatment of type 2 diabetes in several ways:

  1. The herb decoction: A decoction made from the powdered avarampoo can be consumed after meals everyday. This helps in lowering the blood sugar levels and helps in regulating metabolism.

  2. Avarampoo powder: The powder of the avarampoo can be taken along with jaggery or honey and consumed 2-3 times daily. This acts as an effective remedy for diabetes.

  3. Avarampoo extract: An extract of the avarampoo herb can be consumed along with a glass of water. This helps in reducing the glucose levels in the blood and also helps in replenishing the cells with needed minerals.

  4. Avarampoo soup: A soup made from the avarampoo herb can be taken as an effective remedy for diabetes. It helps in controlling the sugar levels and also helps in the process of detoxification.

It is important to note that the avarampoo herb must be consumed in moderation as it might cause side-effects if consumed in excess. It is recommended that people suffering from diabetes should consult their ayurvedic physician before start using avarampoo for diabetes.

In addition, it is also important to make some lifestyle changes in order to keep the diabetes under control and these changes include: regular physical activity, healthy eating habits, quitting smoking, and reducing the intake of alcoholic beverages.

Therefore, in conclusion, avarampoo is an effective remedy for diabetes. It is safe to use and helps in controlling the sugar levels in the blood. However, it is important to note that avarampoo must be consumed in moderation and the lifestyle changes should also be taken into consideration to keep the diabetes under control.
